Function Documentation

void icmSetSimulationRandomSeed ( Uns32  lfsrSeed  ) 

Set a seed for randomizing the order in which processors are processed a time slice. The default is no randomization (seed=0).

Parameters:
lfsrSeed New seed.
Bool icmSetSimulationStopTime ( icmTime  newStopTime  ) 

Set the simulation stop time (for icmSimulatePlatform) - takes effect at the end of any current time slice. icmSimulatePlatform will return when this stop time is reached.

Returns:
True if successful.
Parameters:
newStopTime The new stop time (see icmTime).
Bool icmSetSimulationStopTimeDouble ( double  newStopTime  ) 

Same as icmSetSimulationStopTime, accepting a double.

Returns:
True if successful.
Parameters:
newStopTime The new stop time.
Bool icmSetSimulationTimePrecision ( icmTime  precision  ) 

Set the simulation time precision - all event times are rounded to this. Use this if calling from MSVC.

Returns:
True if successful.
Parameters:
precision The precision (see icmTime).
Bool icmSetSimulationTimePrecisionDouble ( double  precision  ) 

Same as icmSetSimulationTimePrecision, accepting a double.

Returns:
True if successful.
Parameters:
precision The precision (see icmTime).
Bool icmSetSimulationTimeSlice ( icmTime  newSliceSize  ) 

Set the simulation time slice size (for icmSimulatePlatform) - takes effect at the end of the current time slice.

Returns:
True if successful.
Parameters:
newSliceSize The new slice duration (see icmTime).
Bool icmSetSimulationTimeSliceDouble ( double  newSliceSize  ) 

Same as icmSetSimulationTimeSlice, accepting a double. Use this if calling from MSVC.

Returns:
True if successful.
Parameters:
newSliceSize New slice duration.
void icmSetWallClockFactor ( double  factor  ) 

This specifies the maximum multiple of real time at which the simulation should run. If this is not specified (and the ICM_WALLCLOCK attribute is not specified) then the simulation will run as fast as possible. A value of 2.0 implies no faster than twice real time; a value of 0.5 implies no faster than half real time. It may be necessary to specify this to keep interactive prompts from going by too quickly or to get semi-hosted peripherals such as UARTs or NICs to function properly.

Parameters:
factor Scale factor to apply.
